subject: Economics

title: The Savings and Loan Crisis: America's Forgotten Bailout
description: A fast breakdown of The Savings and Loan Crisis: America's Forgotten Bailout for builders.

hook.text: In the 1980s, 1,043 American savings banks failed. The taxpayer bill: $132 billion.

buildup.text: Deregulation let savings institutions invest in risky real estate and junk bonds.

discovery.text: Moral hazard: when deposits are insured, banks take bigger risks. If they win, they profit. If they lose, taxpayers pay.

twist.text: The Keating Five scandal showed US senators protecting a failing banker in exchange for campaign donations.

punchline.text: The 2008 crisis wasn't unprecedented. We just forgot the last time.
